授業目的: This course explores the contour and characteristics of Japanese foodways in modern times with reference to historical developments in the country as well as global trends. Emphasizing the tension between change and continuity, it challenges students to examine broader issues such as identity, global trade, and social change through the prism of food.
到達目標: By taking this course, students will gain a critical understanding of Japanese foodways in the present as well as its relations to history, politics, economics, and culture. Through the writing assignments, they will acquire skills in social and cultural analysis and expository writing.
授業方法:
Online format: Simultaneous and two-way.
Mini lecture, class discussion, essay writing, presentation. Zoom lessons for students who have received permission to study online.
